place.name: CAPEL GARMON
place.gazetteerText: CAPEL-GARMON, or Garth-Garmon, a chapelry in Llanrwst parish, Denbigh; on the river Conway, 4½ miles S by E of Llanrwst r. station. Post Town, Llanrwst. Statistics returned with the parish. The property is much subdivided. The living is a p. curacy in the diocese of St. Asaph. Value, not reported. Patron, the Rector of Llanrwst. The church is not good. There is an Independent chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
